ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
Class AbstractResourceSelection

java.lang.Object
  ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.AbstractResourceSelection
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceSelection
Direct Known Subclasses:
CiSS, ReDDE, SUSHI
public abstract class AbstractResourceSelection
extends Object
implements ResourceSelection

An abstract implementation of SD resource selection. getResourceScores(List, List) must be overridden by subclasses.

Author:
Ilya Markov

Field Detail

completeRankCutoff

protected int completeRankCutoff
A rank at which a complete ranking of documents is truncated. All documents above the complete rank cutoff are considered by SD resource selection and all documents bellow the cutoff are discarded.

The complete rank cutoff is used by default.

sampleRankCutoff

protected int sampleRankCutoff
A rank at which a sample ranking of documents is truncated. All documents above the cutoff are considered by SD resource selection and all documents bellow the cutoff are discarded.

The sample rank cutoff is used only if set by setSampleRankCutoff(int). In these case completeRankCutoff is ignored.

AbstractResourceSelection

setCompleteRankCutoff

public void setCompleteRankCutoff(int completeRankCutoff)
Sets the complete rank cutoff. The complete rank cutoff should be positive.

If set, completeRankCutoff is used, while sampleRankCutoff is ignored.

Parameters:
completeRankCutoff - The complete rank cutoff.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if completeRankCutoff is less than or equal to zero.

select

public <T> List<ScoredEntity<Resource>> select(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                               List<Resource> resources)
Description copied from interface: ResourceSelection
Given a list of scored documents and a list of corresponding resources, calculates a score for each resource and ranks resources by their scores. Returns an ordered list of scored resources. Resources are ordered descending with respect to their scores.

Each resource in the resources list should correspond to a document in the documents list, i.e. resources.get(i) is a resource of documents.get(i). Therefore, the lists should be of the same length.

Documents should not be necessarily sorted by their scores.

Specified by:
select in interface ResourceSelection
Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
Returns:
A descending ordered list of scored resources.
See Also:
ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.ResourceSelection#select(List>, java.util.List)

getResourceScores

protected abstract <T> Map<Resource,Double> getResourceScores(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                                              List<Resource> resources)
Calculates scores for resources in resources based on the ranking of scored documents in documents. Returns a mapping between resources and their scores.

At this point scored documents must be sorted descending with respect to their scores.

This method must be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
Returns:
The mapping between resources and their scores.

checkSorting

protected <T> boolean checkSorting(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents)
Checks if a given list of scored documents is sorted descending with respect to document scores. Returns true if and only if it is sorted and false otherwise.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
Returns:
true if and only if the list of scored documents is sorted descending with respect to document scores and false otherwise.

getSampleRank

protected <T> int getSampleRank(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                List<Resource> resources,
                                int completeRank)
Calculates what rank in a sample list of documents corresponds to a given complete rank. For example, if a document is from a resource with the size R and the size of its corresponding sample is S, then the complete rank of such document is estimated as rank_of_previous_doc + R / S.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
completeRank - The complete rank.
Returns:
The sample rank corresponding to the given complete rank.

getDocument2Resource

protected <T> Map<Resource,List<ScoredEntity<T>>> getDocument2Resource(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                                                       List<Resource> resources)
For each distinct resource in resources extracts a list of corresponding documents from documents. Returns the obtained mapping between resources and documents.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
Returns:
The mapping between resources and documents.

sort

protected <T> void sort(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                        List<Resource> resources)
Sorts documents in descending order with respect to their scores. Reorders resources to maintain the original correspondence.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents to sort.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.

sort

protected <T> void sort(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                        List<Resource> resources,
                        int top)
Sorts first top documents in descending order with respect to their scores. Reorders resources to maintain the original correspondence.

Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents to sort.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
top - Indicates how many documents should be sorted.

Converts a mapping between resources and their scores to a list of scored resources.

The list of scored resources.

addZeroScoredResources

private void addZeroScoredResources(List<Resource> resources,
                                    List<ScoredEntity<Resource>> scoredResources)
For all resources from resources that do not appear in scoredResources adds them to scoredResources with zero score.

Parameters:
resources - The list of resources.
scoredResources - The list of scored resources.
